Detailed Description

This class and its inheriting classes will create, delete and manage OpenGL resources such as display list, VBO buffers and textures.
No objects of this class can be constructed only of the specific inheriting classes. Each graphical object should call a constructor from the derived class and specify how many resources it needs

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

OpenGLResourceManager::OpenGLResourceManager ( OpenViBE::uint32  n) [protected]

Creates an array to hold n OpenGL resource id's of type GLuint

Parameters:
nnumber of resource id's that will need to be managed
OpenGLResourceManager::OpenGLResourceManager ( OpenGLResourceManager *  gl_manager) [protected]

Copy constructor. It will copy the resource ids and increase their count by one.
The static member variable m_mIdCountMap keeps track of all resource ids managed by all OpenGLResourceManager objects and their count, i.e. how many OpenGLResourceManager objects that are using the same resource.

OpenGLResourceManager::~OpenGLResourceManager ( ) [virtual]

Destructor deletes the array holding the resource ids

Member Function Documentation

virtual void OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::_createResources ( ) [protected, pure virtual]

Pure virtual function that calls the specific OpenGL (depending on the derived class, e.g. glGenLists) code to create the resources

Implemented in OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLDListManager, OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLTextureManager, and OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLVBOManager.

virtual void OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::_deleteResource ( GLuint *  resource_id) [protected, pure virtual]

Pure virtual function that calls the specific OpenGL (depending on the derived class, e.g. glGenLists) code to delete the resources

Parameters:
resource_idthe resource id that needs to be deleted

Implemented in OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLDListManager, OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLTextureManager, and OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLVBOManager.

virtual OpenGLResourceManager* OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::clone ( ) const [pure virtual]

Pure virtual clone function calls the copy constructor

Implemented in OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLDListManager, OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLTextureManager, and OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLVBOManager.

void OpenGLResourceManager::createResources ( OpenGLResourceManager *  context) [static, protected]

Calls context->_createResources() on the derived OpenGLResourceManager class object which creates a number of specific OpenGL resources and sets the resource ids. It then inserts the ids in the static member map m_mIdCountMap with count one.

Parameters:
contextthe derived OpenGLResourceManager class object which will call the specific OpenGL code to request the resources
See also:
_createResources()
virtual void OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::deleteResources ( ) [pure virtual]

TODO: I have the feeling this function should be hidden somehow
Pure virtual function that in its derived class implementations calls the protected OpenGLResourceManager::deleteResources(this)

See also:
deleteResources(OpenGLResourceManager* context)

Implemented in OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLDListManager, OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLTextureManager, and OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLVBOManager.

void OpenGLResourceManager::deleteResources ( OpenGLResourceManager *  context) [static, protected]

It will iterate over all resource ids that are managed by the OpenGLResourceManager object context and decrease their count by one. In case the count reaches zero, the OpenGL resource will be deleted, if not the display list, vbo buffer or texture remains alive

Parameters:
contextthe OpenGLResourceManager for which the resources can be released (if count reaches zero)
virtual OpenViBE::uint32 OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::getNumberOfResources ( ) [inline, virtual]
Returns:
the number of OpenGL resources OpenGLResourceManager manages
virtual GLuint OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::getResource ( OpenViBE::uint32  gl_index) [inline, virtual]
Parameters:
gl_indexthe index for which you want to get the resource id. If OpenGLResourceManager manages two display lists for example then you can retrieve the resource id of the second one by specifying gl_index=1
Returns:
the resource id at index gl_index
virtual std::map<GLuint, OpenViBE::uint32>& OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::getResourceMap ( ) [protected, pure virtual]
Returns:
the static member map that keeps track of the resource ids and their counts

Implemented in OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLDListManager, OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLTextureManager, and OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLVBOManager.

Member Data Documentation

std::map<GLuint, OpenViBE::uint32> OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLResourceManager::m_mIdCountMap [static, protected]

the map that keeps track of all the resource ids requested by all manager class objects of a specific type and the associated count of their use

Reimplemented in OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLDListManager, OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLTextureManager, and OpenViBEApplications::OpenGLVBOManager.
